evolution_stages.conversation_summary: Discussed presentation nerves (speaking too fast) and career exploration challenges. Solutions included: 1) Presentation techniques (metronome practice, recording rehearsals, marketing club opportunity) - Lisa scheduled practice session and developed creative Apple/Android presentation; 2) Career preparation (LinkedIn optimization, certification completion) - Lisa updated headline/skills and reframed internship experiences with quantifiable results; 3) Interview prep - Lisa successfully articulated internship ethics framework. Progress evidenced by scheduled commitments, LinkedIn improvements, and confident practice session role-playing using humor/data. Lisa showed enthusiastic adoption of solutions through immediate action on LinkedIn and presentation planning.

evolution_stages.conversation_summary: Discussed 1) Presentation anxiety (specifically pacing and fear of judgment), 2) Weak LinkedIn profile hindering job search, and 3) Need for interview preparation strategies. Solutions offered included: metronome pacing practice, presentation recording, LinkedIn headline/skills overhaul, internship achievement quantification ('22% trust increase', '31% engagement boost'), and ethics interview role-playing. Lisa accepted all solutions enthusiastically - immediately updated LinkedIn headline/skills, scheduled presentation practice session, and reframed her Android bias as analytical strength. Evidence of progress includes: developed full presentation structure with data-driven arguments, created marketable STAR story from internship, and demonstrated increased self-awareness about professional/personal balance in branding. She committed to concrete next steps including Tuesday practice session and Thursday marketing club presentation.

evolution_stages.conversation_summary: Discussed 1) Presentation anxiety (pacing, polish) and 2) Career path uncertainty (digital marketing roles, weak LinkedIn). Solutions: For presentations, offered metronome pacing practice, 'rephrase' recovery tactic, reframing personal perspective as asset, and Marketing Club practice opportunity. For career, provided LinkedIn optimization tactics (headline/skills templates), alum outreach template, and certification visibility strategy. Student responded positively: Committed to recording practice, volunteered for Marketing Club slot, updated LinkedIn headline/skills immediately, and applied reframing technique to turn Android bias into presentation strength ('objective outsider analysis'). Evidence of improvement: Developed creative presentation angle (Android vs Apple rivalry), implemented specific LinkedIn changes, generated own content ideas (72% market share stat), and demonstrated solution ownership through A/B testing suggestion for bio.
